head.supplied: [ ¶ Dr. J. W. Barrett, the Hon. Secretary, read a letter from Baron von Mueller, stating that he had intended to attend the meeting to take part in person in the offering of felicitations to Dr. Barke...

p.seg: To the Medical Society of Victoria

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Letter not found. The text given here is from a report of the meeting of the Medical Society of Victoria held on 3 September 1890,

15 September 1890, p. 390. Before the presentation of cases and papers, the meeting honoured Dr William Barker, 'on the completion of his fiftieth year of medical practice, and his forty-sixth year of practice in Victoria'.

Dr. J. W. Barrett, the Hon. Secretary, read a letter from Baron von Mueller, stating that he had intended to attend the meeting to take part in person in the offering of felicitations to Dr. Barker, but found he was unable to be present.
